Experiment Method.Assay Method: Hydrogen/Deuterium Exchange coupled to NMR Spectroscopy

Material used.Material Name: 15N isotope labeled wt and A30P aS
Material used.Description: 15N isotope labeled recombinant wt and A30P aS were expressed and purified from E. Coli.

Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutation does not cause changes in the number, location, and overall arrangement of beta-strands in amyloid fibrils of alpha-synuclein.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type aS was used as a reference for comparison with A30P mutant.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Single exponential curve fitting was used to analyze back-exchange profiles.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Deuterium incorporation levels similar to wild-type aS, indicating no significant structural change.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in deuterium incorporation levels compared to wild-type aS, indicating structural changes.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: High-Resolution Magic Angle Spinning (HR-MAS) NMR Spectroscopy

Material used.Material Name: 15N isotope labeled wt and A30P aS
Material used.Description: 15N isotope labeled recombinant wt and A30P aS were expressed and purified from E. Coli.

Readout description.Result Description: HR-MAS NMR showed that several residues within the fibrillar core retain nano-second dynamics, with no significant structural differences induced by the A30P mutation.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type aS was used as a reference for comparison with A30P mutant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Chemical shift differences and peak intensities similar to wild-type aS, indicating no significant structural change.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in chemical shift differences or peak intensities compared to wild-type aS, indicating structural changes.

Material used.Description: aS fibrils were prepared on a glow-discharged carbon foil and stained with 1% uranyl acetate.

Readout description.Result Description: Electron microscopy showed a morphology characteristic of amyloid fibrils with no significant differences between wild-type and A30P aS.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type aS was used as a reference for comparison with A30P mutant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Morphology characteristic of amyloid fibrils, similar to wild-type aS.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in fibril morphology compared to wild-type aS.

Material used.Description: Protein solutions were prepared in 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.5 at 25 C), 100 mM NaCl and 0.02% NaN3 with protein concentrations of approximately 100 ÂµM.

Readout description.Result Description: Thioflavin T fluorescence was used to monitor fibrillization, but specific results for A30P variant compared to wild-type were not detailed in the context of structural differences.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type aS was used as a reference for comparison with A30P mutant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence levels indicative of amyloid fibril formation, similar to wild-type aS.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in fluorescence levels compared to wild-type aS, indicating altered fibrillization kinetics.
